p: The severe respiratory failure caused by COVID-19 infection results in acute hypoxemia, which is associated with severe ventilation/perfusion (V/Q) mismatch and overt intrapulmonary shunting [ 3, 4]. However, the exact mechanism of respiratory failure remains unclear and there is evidence that pulmonary microvascular thrombosis due to thrombo-inflammation may be a major factor contributing to respiratory decompensation in these patients [ 5].
